SEARCH
Package DiceRoller

Class DiceRoller

java.lang.Object
DiceRoller.DiceRoller
public class DiceRoller extends Object

DiceRoller

A program that allows the user to add, remove, roll, and delete a list of dice.
Since:
2024-11-08

  • Field Details

    • dice_list

      private ArrayList<Dice> dice_list

    • scanner

      private Scanner scanner

  • Constructor Details

    • DiceRoller

      public DiceRoller()
      Class constructor specifying an empty list of dice and a scanner.

  • Method Details

    • main

      public static void main(String[] args)

    • showAllDice

      public void showAllDice()
      Prints out a list of all the dice that are currently in the program.

    • printDiceList

      private void printDiceList()
      Prints out a list of all the dice in the program by printing each dice's name, separated by spaces.

    • showMenu

      public void showMenu()
      Prints out a menu for the user to select an option with. The options are to add a dice, remove a dice, roll all dice, delete all dice, or exit the program.

    • inputMenu

      public int inputMenu()
      Asks the user for input and returns an integer representing the user's choice, which should be one of the numbers 1 to 5.
      Returns:
      an integer representing the user's choice.

    • chooseMenu

      public void chooseMenu(int choice)
      Executes an action based on the user's menu choice.
      Parameters:
      choice - an integer representing the user's menu selection, where: 1 - adds a dice, 2 - removes a dice, 3 - rolls all dice and shows the result, 4 - deletes all dice, 5 - exits the program. Any other choice prints an invalid choice message.

    • addDice

      private void addDice()
      Asks the user for the number of sides of a dice, creates a new Dice object with that number of sides, and adds it to the dice_list.

    • makeDice

      private Dice makeDice()
      Asks the user for the number of sides of a dice and creates a new Dice object with that number of sides.
      Returns:
      a new Dice object created with the user's input.

    • inputDiceSideNumber

      private int inputDiceSideNumber()
      Asks the user for the number of sides of a dice and returns the number that the user entered.
      Returns:
      the number of sides of the dice that the user entered.

    • removeDice

      private void removeDice()
      Asks the user for the number of sides of a dice and removes the first dice with that number of sides from the dice_list. If there is no dice with that number of sides, does nothing.

    • searchDice

      private int searchDice(int side)
      Searches the dice_list for the first dice with a certain number of sides and returns the index of that dice in the list. If no dice with that number of sides is found, returns -1.
      Parameters:
      side - the number of sides to search for.
      Returns:
      the index of the first dice with the given number of sides, or -1 if no dice with that number of sides is found.

    • showRollResult

      private void showRollResult()
      Clears the console, prints out the result of rolling all the dice in the program, and then waits for the user to press any key.

    • rollAllDice

      private Map<String,Integer> rollAllDice()
      Rolls all the dice in the program and returns a map where the keys are the names of the dice and the values are the results of the dice roll.
      Returns:
      a map where the keys are the names of the dice and the values are the results of the dice roll.

    • removeAllDice

      private void removeAllDice()
      Clears the dice_list by removing all the dice from it. This means that there will be no dice left in the program.

    • cls

      public static final void cls()
      Clears the console screen. Currently, this implementation only supports clearing the screen on Windows operating systems. If an error occurs during the execution of the command, the stack trace is printed.

    • pause

      public static final void pause()
      Waits for the user to press any key before continuing. This is used to pause the program and prevent the console window from closing immediately after the program is run from an IDE.
